description:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20263/ introduced a bug where nova api crashes if a service catalog doesn't exist.

nova/api/auth.py pulls the X_SERVICE_CATALOG header, but if that doesn't exist, explicitly passes the None on to the RequestContext. The RequestContext now crashes because the code expects a list, as it is defaulted in a kwarg to an empty list.
title: Passing None to RequestContext crashes

comments.content:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20263/ introduced a bug where nova api crashes if a service catalog doesn't exist.

nova/api/auth.py pulls the X_SERVICE_CATALOG header, but if that doesn't exist, explicitly passes the None on to the RequestContext. The RequestContext now crashes because the code expects a list, as it is defaulted in a kwarg to an empty list.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~corystone

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/24667
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/24667
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/4664d2294aed498ef013afc1689740f03de80a6c
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 4664d2294aed498ef013afc1689740f03de80a6c
Author: Davanum Srinivas <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Mar 18 15:28:57 2013 -0400

    Fix RequestContext crashes w/ no service catalog
    
    Code introduced in a prev review assumed service_catalog will be
    at least an empty list and will never be None.  But missed one code
    path where the service_catalog could potentially be set to None. So
    this change switches back the default value of service_catalog in
    the arguments to None and makes sure we tolerate anyone else
    passing in a None or Empty list as service_catalog
    
    Fix for LP# 1156730
    
    Change-Id: I480b761d57c4699ea7ef72114160cdbeb281e454
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
